definition: to affect/to produce a change in sth
to lead along/to pull (an animal on a tether)/(bound form) to involve/to draw in
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: As difficult as it may be at times, try not to take negative feedback personally.
sentences.chinese: 回复时尽可能不牵动个人情绪，虽然有时候很难做到。

sentences.english: On one side of the canal is historical relics, another side modern arts, both of which bring Otaru two different feelings.
sentences.chinese: 运河一面古迹，一面时尚，牵动着小樽的两种情绪。

sentences.english: "You should want to have that paper because you want to get married with me?" The man bent his brows .
sentences.chinese: “你想结婚不就是想要那张纸吗？”男人牵动了下眉。

sentences.english: Four years after production stopped, the sight and sound of the GT is still breathtaking.
sentences.chinese: 停产4年后，GT的“音容笑貌”仍旧牵动我心。

sentences.english: Prayer is the slender sinew that moves the muscle of omnipotence.
sentences.chinese: 祷告是细长的肌腱可以牵动无所不能者的肌肉。

sentences.english: His work has touched millions, and has made their lives better.
sentences.chinese: 他的工作牵动千百万人，使他们的生活更美好。

sentences.english: Migrant workers in the disaster areas to return home affect the way the hearts of the people of Xi'an.
sentences.chinese: 灾区平易近工的回家之路牵动着西安人平易近的心。

sentences.english: This description certainly strikes a chord with me.
sentences.chinese: 这个描述肯定牵动了我的心弦。

sentences.english: Yi sleet affects a corner of jaws hard ugg claccic also wants apt extrude an silk smile.
sentences.chinese: 伊雪努力的牵动嘴角，还想挤出一丝微笑。

sentences.english: We are the persons who are gently affected and become fascinated when we think of Junki!
sentences.chinese: 是一想到俊基，心就会温柔地牵动，微微出神地人。

sentences.english: It takes 17 muscles to smile and 43 to frown.
sentences.chinese: 皱眉需要牵动43条肌肉，而微笑只用17条。

sentences.english: This a little maple's woods, affects my heart.
sentences.chinese: 这一片小小的枫林，牵动着我的心。

sentences.english: It matters to the people of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 你的生命牵动着美国人民的心。

sentences.english: It involves the transmutation of fear within you, first and foremost.
sentences.chinese: 它会首先牵动你们的内在恐惧，引起嬗变。

sentences.english: Every time a substantial balance shot swing, all tightly touches the hearts of the audience.
sentences.chinese: 平衡杆每一次大幅度摆动，都紧紧地牵动着观众的心。

sentences.english: Only gives fully in prose of filar detailed sorrow to affect my nerve.
sentences.chinese: 只有散文中透出的丝缕哀愁才能牵动我的神经。

definition: to touch/to stir up (trouble or emotions)/to move (sb's emotions or worry)
to evoke/to induce/to call to mind/to pick up with a hook
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
to rage/to dash/to surge/also written 激盪|激荡
billows/great waves (fig. of a story with great momentum)
to shake up/to deal a shock/(fig.) to stir (sb's heart)
